issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for Work-Related Injuries Implementation
issues.description: While the Board Policy establishes the framework for work-related injury reporting and workers' compensation, there is no Administrative Regulation to provide the detailed procedures for implementation. California Education Code requires specific procedural elements that are typically detailed in AR documents, including specific timeframes, forms, investigation procedures, and detailed notification processes.

legal_citations.text: Requires school districts to establish procedures for handling work-related injuries and workers' compensation claims

issues.required_language: An Administrative Regulation should be developed to include: specific reporting timeframes, required forms and documentation, investigation procedures, return-to-work processes, recordkeeping requirements, and detailed notification procedures for both employees and supervisors.

issues.title: Missing Specific Reporting Timeframe Requirements
issues.description: The policy states employees should report injuries "as soon as practicable" but does not specify the required timeframes under California workers' compensation law. Labor Code Section 5401 requires specific timing for injury reporting.

legal_citations.text: Requires that work-related injuries be reported within specific timeframes to preserve workers' compensation rights

issues.required_language: Employees must report work-related injuries immediately or as soon as practical, but no later than 30 days after the injury occurs or the employee becomes aware that the injury is work-related.

issues.title: Missing Required Workers' Compensation Notice Content
issues.description: While the policy mentions that notifications must be posted "in accordance with law," it does not specify the required content of workers' compensation notices or reference the specific notices required by California Labor Code.

legal_citations.text: Requires employers to post specific workers' compensation notices and provide employees with information about their rights

issues.required_language: The district shall post the official "Workers' Compensation - Rights and Benefits" notice (Form DWC-7) and provide employees with information about their right to select a treating physician, claim procedures, and disability benefits as required by Labor Code Section 3550.

issues.title: Missing Return-to-Work Program Requirements
issues.description: California Labor Code encourages employers to establish return-to-work programs, and Education Code requires districts to have procedures for accommodating injured employees. Neither the policy nor regulation addresses return-to-work procedures.

legal_citations.text: Provides for supplemental job displacement benefits and encourages return-to-work programs for injured employees

issues.required_language: The district shall establish procedures for facilitating the return to work of employees who have sustained work-related injuries, including modified duty assignments when appropriate and coordination with medical providers regarding work restrictions.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Required Forms
issues.description: The policy does not reference the specific forms required for workers' compensation claims, such as the DWC-1 claim form that must be provided to injured employees.

legal_citations.text: Requires employers to provide injured employees with a claim form (DWC-1) within one working day of notice of injury

issues.required_language: Injured employees shall be provided with a workers' compensation claim form (DWC-1) within one working day of reporting the injury.
